title: How to Make a Final Edit of Your Portfolio Images
author: Chamira Young
body:
As a photographer, images
are just the start. How do you decide which are your best photographs? How do
you selectively choose the best that represent your style, and then what’s the
best way to display those in a portfolio to someone who may not be familiar
with your work?

It's important to keep your objective and style in
mind when it comes to this final edit of your portfolio. You have your
selections in one folder, and your rejections in another, but it’s wise to make
one more pass of the ‘selections’ to make sure that your offering really is the
best it can be.
As we discovered in the last lesson, on
how to make a rough cut of your portfolio

, it’s wise to
take a break from this so that you can come back to your choices with fresh
eyes. Take another look through your rejection folder, just to be sure. By now,
you should be feeling pretty confident about your decisions and be ready to
start assembling them.
